commText: Rahul and Arshin Kulkarni are at the crease. Rahul is on strike. N Thushara will open the attack
N Thushara to Rahul, no run, low full toss, swings from middle to off, watchfully pushed to mid-on
KL Rahul vs MI 16 inngs 867 runs Avg 86.70 SR 135.89 100s/50s 3/5 Last two knocks: 103*(60) & 103*(62)
N Thushara to Rahul, no run, 133.7kph, gets forward and knocks this full ball to mid-on
N Thushara to Rahul, 1 run, 133.9kph, good length outside off, punched to deep point
N Thushara to Arshin Kulkarni, THATS OUT!! Lbw!!

N Thushara to Arshin Kulkarni, out Lbw!! 137.9kph, lbw appeal, turned down. Hardik has a chat with his team-mates and reviews it. Fullish outswinger, Arshin Kulkarni walks forward and across to work it into the leg-side and then gets squared up. The ball beats the outside edge to rap him on the front pad adjacent to the sticks. Clearly no bat and it's three reds on HawkEye! Hitting middle! Contrasting emotions for the bowler and batter. Maiden IPL wicket for Nuwan Thushara while debutant Kulkarni is gone for a golden duck. Arshin Kulkarni lbw b N Thushara 0(1)
Marcus Stoinis, right handed bat, comes to the crease
N Thushara to Stoinis, no run, Malinga-esque full outswinger outside off, Stoinis chases without any feet movement and is beaten on the outside edge!
N Thushara to Stoinis, no run, 133.8kph, another one curling away outside off, Stoinis decides to shoulder arms at the last moment
Golden duck on debut IPL innings (Openers) \nJoe Denly KKR vs DC Kolkata 2019 \nArshin Kulkarni LSG vs MI Lucknow 2024
Jasprit Bumrah, right-arm fast, comes into the attack
Bumrah to Rahul, no run, 133.2kph, with a slip in place, Bumrah starts with an inswinger that further nips back in, Rahul blocks from the crease
Bumrah to Rahul, no run, 136.4kph, outswinger on a good length and around off, Rahul taps it to cover
Bumrah to Rahul, 2 runs, 137.3kph, full and swinging in, pad-lined, flicked away to deep backward square leg. Wadhera dives to his right in the deep to make a superb stop, Bumrah applauds
Bumrah to Rahul, no run, clipped to the left of short midwicket where Hardik makes a diving stop
Bumrah to Rahul, 1 run, 137.4kph, in-seamer, Rahul pushes with hard hands and inside-edges to deep square leg

Bumrah to Stoinis, FOUR, 139.5kph, inswinging yorker, Stoinis hurriedly brings his bat down and he gets a lucky boundary. The ball trims the inner edge, eludes the leg-stump and dribbles away to fine leg for four
N Thushara to Rahul, wide, 137.4kph, Thushara spills this full delivery down the leg-side
N Thushara to Rahul, no run, length ball on the stumps, blocked
N Thushara to Rahul, no run, 118.1kph, slower delivery, Rahul drives straight to cover
N Thushara to Rahul, no run, good length ball, Rahul taps it into the off-side
N Thushara to Rahul, no run, 137.1kph, good length on off, Rahul defends into the off-side with a squared up stance
N Thushara to Rahul, 1 run, 124.3kph, full outside off, Rahul opens his bat-face to drive through point
N Thushara to Stoinis, 1 run, 131.6kph, length ball marginally outside off, Stoinis stands tall to punch and inside-halves it towards mid-on for a quick single
Gerald Coetzee, right-arm fast, comes into the attack
Gerald Coetzee to Stoinis, 1 run, 134kph, back of a length, Stoinis stands tall to punch it to mid-off's left
Gerald Coetzee to Rahul, wide, 145.1kph, in-dart down leg, Rahul misses the flick
Gerald Coetzee to Rahul, 1 run, 146.3kph, leg-lined, glanced to long leg
Gerald Coetzee to Stoinis, 2 runs, 141.6kph, short ball, Stoinis hurriedly pulls and miscues it over midwicket. The ball plugs and the batsmen take two
Gerald Coetzee to Stoinis, 2 runs, 144.5kph, fuller in length, neatly clipped through midwicket for another brace. Wadhera sprints to his left in the deep to keep the batters down to two
Gerald Coetzee to Stoinis, FOUR, 147.1kph, shortened length, the height doesn't trouble the batter and Stoinis swivels to pull it fiercely in front of square on the leg-side. No one's stopping this

Gerald Coetzee to Stoinis, FOUR, 144.9kph, in-slanting back of a length ball, pulled away over midwicket. A couple of bounces and into the fence. 15 runs off Coetzee's opening over! Pressure released...
N Thushara to Rahul, FOUR, 135.7kph, poor delivery and Rahul pounces. Very full and down the leg-side, Rahul flicks it away to fine leg for four
N Thushara to Rahul, 1 run, 135.2kph, back of a length, Rahul walks forward to punch it to sweeper cover
N Thushara to Stoinis, 1 run, 122.5kph, pace off, punched back towards the bowler and Thushara allows the ball to burst through his palms which allows the batsmen to rotate strike

N Thushara to Rahul, SIX, 136.6kph, Rahul walks across, uses the bowler's angle and pace to whip it away over backward square leg. There's a man in the deep but he's made good contact to clear Nabi for a 64m six

N Thushara to Rahul, FOUR, through the off-side now! 125.7kph, Thushara pulls his length back and serves width outside off. Quick hands from Rahul who waits and scythes it behind square on the off-side. Bullets away to the fence

N Thushara to Rahul, FOUR, wow! 139kph, full on middle and leg, Rahul takes his left leg out of the equation and brings his bottom hand into play to flick it over wide mid-on for a one-bounce four. A helicopter shot from the LSG captain. 20 runs off the over

Over Summary (1-5): -- Arshin Kulkarni is gone for a golden duck on IPL debut as Thushara has his number -- Thushara bowls another tight over -- Gerald Coetzee concedes two fours in his first over -- Stoinis off to a quick start -- Thushara bowls an expensive third over as Rahul takes him apart
Jasprit Bumrah [1.0-0-7-0] is back into the attack
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, 124kph, slower delivery, not picked by the batter who is early to drive. The ball beats the inside edge to go towards the keeper
Bumrah to Stoinis, SIX, 123.1kph, pace off again, Stoinis picks this, presses half-forward and thumps it over long-off for an 86m six. Fifty partnership off just 28 deliveries
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, 143.7kph, outswinger, Stoinis stays leg-side to drive/punch and the length ball beats the outside edge
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, back of a length, defended into the off-side
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, 140.8kph, full delivery and that's been pushed towards cover
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, short one to end the over and Stoinis hops to defend it into the pitch
Piyush Chawla, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack

Chawla to Rahul, 1 run, did the man at cover get a hand on it? That was slapped hard as it was tossed up wide outside off. I0$ but that was going at the pace of knots. He didn't have much time to react. Chawla could have had a wicket off the first ball
Chawla to Stoinis, no run, gets behind the ball and defends it out into the off-side
Chawla to Stoinis, no run, stabs it down into the off-side to find point. Got it off the outer-half of the bat
Chawla to Stoinis, FOUR, chips down the track, was the googly and the batter glanced it fine. Was well bowled but Stoinis did well to get that fine and get a four
Chawla to Stoinis, no run, quicker one, on the pads at 96.2 kph. The batter tucks it down to mid-wicket
Chawla to Stoinis, no run, flatter one, 95.5 kph, Stoinis chops the ball down and finds the man at short third. 88 needed off 78 balls
Hardik Pandya, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, 2 runs, Pandya has to create some magic but starts with a length delivery and Rahul punched it on the up. The man at deep cover did well to cut it off to his right. Couple added to the tally
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, out Caught by Nabi!! I0$. Huge wicket for Pandya and MI. Rahul has a phenomenal record against MI but not today. Nabi takes an excellent catch at deep mid. Was a length delivery and Rahul swung hard at it and across the line. The ball went very high and Nabi had almost one leg off the turf when he took it. But his body still had the balance to be inside the field of play. Superb from the veteran. MI needed a boost and they have it. Rahul c Nabi b Hardik Pandya 28(22) [4s-3 6s-1]
Deepak Hooda, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Hardik Pandya to Hooda, 1 run, angles one on to the pads, tucked down to fine leg for a single
Hardik Pandya to Stoinis, no run, another dot. Length delivery at 138.4 kph, shapes in, outside off, Stoinis stabbed back to the bowler
Hardik Pandya to Stoinis, 1 run, back of a length delivery, Stoinis stands tall and punches that 137.4 kph delivery into the off-side to find the man at deep cover

Hardik Pandya to Hooda, no run, good end to an excellent over. Hardik Pandya bent his back in the over and also had a wicket. Was a back of a length delivery at 133.7 kph. Hooda punched it to the man at cover
Chawla to Stoinis, FOUR, tossed up delivery, at 93.6 kph, Stoinis sits down and slog sweeps it flat and hard. Easily beats the man at deep mid. Stoinis in fine form and that should be worrying for MI
Chawla to Stoinis, 1 run, sits down and sweeps the ball down to long leg for a single
Chawla to Hooda, 1 run, flatter one, outside off at 93.8 kph, Hooda punches it down to long-off for a single
Chawla to Stoinis, 2 runs, couple more. Chawla goes wide of the crease and drops it short. The man at sweeper cover fumbles and allows one more extra run
Chawla to Stoinis, 1 run, punches it over the head of the bowler. Was on the back foot and lofted it down the ground. The man at long-off cut it off
Chawla to Hooda, 1 run, flogs one down to deep square for a single as that was at the sticks. Had he missed it, would have been in trouble

22:24 Local Time, 16:54 GMT, 22:24 IST: Time-out. MI clawed back some ground by removing Rahul. But Stoinis is looking good and Hooda has been decent in the four balls he has faced. Uphill task for MI as they need a few wickets to script a turn around on a wicket which looks slightly sluggish. Pandya has to be very alert as they aren't defending a big total. 74 needed off 66 balls now.

Hardik Pandya to Hooda, FOUR, and poor start for Pandya. A nothing delivery. Length delivery, sits up and Hooda flogged it across the line. Could have timed it better. The man at deep square tried to dive to his left but failed to get there
Hardik Pandya to Hooda, 2 runs, mistimes the hoick on to the on-side for a couple of runs as that was a slower delivery angled in
Hardik Pandya to Hooda, no run, short of length delivery, outside off, chopped down to the man at point. Was little outside off and Hooda played it off the back foot but found the fielder
Hardik Pandya to Hooda, no run, excellent short ball! Hooda danced down blind and Pandya ushered in the short ball. Hooda bailed out and dropped his wrosts to let it go to the keeper
Hardik Pandya to Hooda, 1 run, short of length delivery, angled in, Hooda nudged it wide of mid-wicket for a single
Hardik Pandya to Stoinis, 1 run, short of a length delivery, outside off, Stoinis waits on that 140.1 kph delivery and chops it past point for a single

Over Summary (6-10) - 32 runs | 1 wicket -- Fifty partnership between Rahul & Stoinis off 28 deliveries -- Hardik removes his counterpart, much-needed for MI -- 10 runs off Chawla's 2nd over -- Stoinis looking in good touch
Gerald Coetzee [1.0-0-15-0] is back into the attack
Gerald Coetzee to Stoinis, wide, starts with a slower delivery down leg. Stoinis missed the clip and was wided
Gerald Coetzee to Stoinis, 1 run, LSG keeping an eye on the NRR. Was a short ball, Stoinis looked to pull and cue-ended it down to fine leg
Gerald Coetzee to Hooda, no run, angles in, on a length, nudged down to mid-wicket
Gerald Coetzee to Hooda, 1 run, short of length delivery, well wide outside off, toe-ended down to third man for a single

Gerald Coetzee to Stoinis, no run, short ball, outside off, Stoinis bails out of the pull. He thought of a pull but then backed out. Was looking for a wide for height but the umpire deemed it as a legal ball
Gerald Coetzee to Stoinis, 1 run, short ball, mistimed down to deep mid for a single
Gerald Coetzee to Hooda, wide, short ball, angled in, has been wided this time. That sailed into the gloves of the keeper
Gerald Coetzee to Hooda, FOUR, short, wide, slashed over point. There was room and put away with elan. The batter went after it and managed to send it over the fielder
Jasprit Bumrah [2.0-0-13-0] is back into the attack
Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 run, short of length delivery, Stoinis stands tall and punches it down to deep cover for a single
Bumrah to Hooda, no run, length delivery, well outside off, Hooda throws his bat at it and misses. The ball swirled away and nestled into the gloves of the keeper
Bumrah to Hooda, 1 run, fuller length delivery, outside off, steered down to third man for a single
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, banged in short, outside off, Stoinis lets it go by dropping his wrists. Stoinis wants to play out Bumrah?
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, fuller and quicker, angled in. Bumrah appealled but Stoinis has a big smile as he knew that was going down leg. Only a dot
Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 run, very full, outside off, Stoinis stabs it down into the off-side for a single
Piyush Chawla [2.0-0-15-0] is back into the attack
Chawla to Stoinis, FOUR, starts a spell with a tossed up delivery, Stoinis gets under it and slams it over the bowler's head for a four. Lovely connection on it and had four written all over it
Chawla to Stoinis, 1 run, goes back and punches the ball down to long-off for a single
Chawla to Hooda, 1 run, reads the googly late and nudges it down to long-on for a single. Over to Stoinis
Chawla to Stoinis, 1 run, well tossed up delivery on the pads and nudged down on to the on-side to deep mid for a single
Chawla to Hooda, no run, dances down, gets beaten by the googly and the ball hits his pads to dribble down into the off-side
Chawla to Hooda, 1 run, pushes it down to long-off for a single
Hardik Pandya [2.0-0-12-1] is back into the attack
Hardik Pandya to Hooda, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Hardik Pandya to Hooda, out Caught by Bumrah!! And taken at mid-off. Was a short of a length delivery, Hooda looked to launch it on the up but failed to the distance or elevation on it. The man at mid-off completed a simple catch. Second wicket for the skipper but is it too late? The batter wanted to go over mid-off but failed to infuse enough power into the shot. The ball hit him higher on the blade I suppose as he tried to punch it over. Hooda c Bumrah b Hardik Pandya 18(18) [4s-2]
Nicholas Pooran, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Hardik Pandya to Pooran, 1 run, gets it off the pads for a single. LSG bring up their ton

Hardik Pandya to Stoinis, 1 run, steers one down to third man for a single. That's fifty for Stoinis and he has stood tall and firm in this chase. His form has been impeccable in this tourney and has helped LSG
Hardik Pandya to Pooran, 1 run, gets behind the line of the delivery and pats it down into the off-side for a single
Hardik Pandya to Stoinis, no run, banged in short, Stoinis was a little too early into the shot. The ball dropped on the keeper
Hardik Pandya to Stoinis, 1 run, short ball, Stoinis gets on top of the bounce and pulls it down to deep mid for a single
Mohammad Nabi, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
Nabi to Stoinis, FOUR, starts with a short ball, outside off, Stoinis waited for the turn and slapped it past point for a four. The match up is ideal for Stoinis and hasn't wasted time

Nabi to Stoinis, SIX, tossed up delivery, Stoinis goes after it and the ball goes over deep mid. Seemed like he didn't time it and it went very high but the ball went over the fence as the long-on and deep mid fielders saw it go over
Nabi to Stoinis, 1 run, flighted one, Stoinis drills it down to long-on for a single
Nabi to Pooran, 1 run, tossed up delivery and has been slog swept down to deep mid for a single
Nabi to Stoinis, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Nabi to Stoinis, out Caught by Tilak Varma at deep mid-wicket!! Soft dismissal. Was a short ball, Stoinis went for the pull and one hand came off the handle. That meant there was no power into the shot and Varma at deep mid managed to gobble it up easily. Was a poor ball but he has to go. Good knock once again from the Aussie all-rounder but has ended. Stoinis c Tilak Varma b Nabi 62(45) [4s-7 6s-2]
Ashton Turner, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Nabi to Turner, 1 run, flatter one, outside off, punched down to deep cover for a single

Over Summary (11-16) - 37 runs | 2 wickets -- 4 off the last ball spoils the over for Coetzee -- Bumrah bowls a tight over -- Hooda falls to Hardik -- 39-ball fifty for Stoinis -- 13 runs & Stoinis's wicket off Nabi's 1st over
Nuwan Thushara [3.0-0-24-1] is back into the attack
N Thushara to Turner, no run, right up there, Turner digs it back to the bowler
N Thushara to Turner, 1 run, very full, slower, Turner clips the ball down to long-on for a single
N Thushara to Pooran, 1 run, gets it behind point for a single as that was very full outside off
N Thushara to Turner, 1 run, back of a length delivery, outside off, punched down to deep cover for a single
N Thushara to Pooran, no run, slower delivery and Pooran is deceived. Was outside off and Pooran looked to slog sweep and missed it
N Thushara to Pooran, 2 wides, couple of wides. Very full, wide outside off, Pooran let it go and the keeper fumbled to give away two runs
N Thushara to Turner, 1 run, fuller length delivery, clipped down to deep mid for a single

23:01 Local Time, 17:31 GMT, 23:01 IST: Final Time-out. LSG on the doorstep of their 6th win. They have really staked a massive claim for a top-four finish this season and today has been another proof of it. They have been clinical from ball 1. MI will look to delay the inevitable. 23 off 24 balls should be a dawdle. MI have tried hard with the ball but they were at least 40 short by the looks of it. Would be the fourth game in succession at this venue to be won by the chasing side.
Jasprit Bumrah [3.0-0-16-0] is back into the attack
Bumrah to Turner, no run, I0$Starts with a length delivery and Turner stabs it out into the off-side
Bumrah to Turner, no run, gets the ball to straighten. Turner gets behind it and pushes it back to the bowler

Bumrah to Turner, 1 run, fuller length delivery, angled in, Turner clipped the drive down to long-on for a single. Has been a good spell from Bumrah but he would have certainly loved a few wickets in the bargain he has had so far
Bumrah to Pooran, no run, length delivery, outside off, Pooran gets behind the line of the delivery and defends it out into the off-side
Bumrah to Pooran, no run, fuller length delivery, Pooran drives it back to the sticks at the bowler's end. The bowler failed to get any touch on it
Bumrah to Pooran, no run, length delivery, outside off, the batter hung back and stabbed it down to point
Gerald Coetzee [2.0-0-24-0] is back into the attack
Gerald Coetzee to Turner, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

Gerald Coetzee to Turner, out Bowled!! Gone. Too late it might be but Turner has to go. Length delivery, was fuller, Turner looked to lap it fine and missed the line of the delivery to be clean bowled. Infact, he got a little edge on it. So, would say he has helped it on to the sticks. Was a quick delivery and Turner tried to preempt the shot but just couldn't get it away. Turner b Gerald Coetzee 5(9)
Ayush Badoni, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Gerald Coetzee to Ayush Badoni, no run, slower length delivery, angled in, Ayush Badoni looked to heave it away on the off-side and misses

Gerald Coetzee to Ayush Badoni, leg byes, FOUR, short of length delivery, angled on to the pads, Ayush Badoni looked to pull and got cramped for the shot but the ball went off the pads and fine. The keeper ran after it but failed to cut it off
Gerald Coetzee to Ayush Badoni, FOUR, top-edge and four! That was short, Ayush Badoni looked to pull and got a top-edge. The ball went very fine and away from the man at long leg for a four
Gerald Coetzee to Ayush Badoni, no run, slower short ball, Ayush Badoni looked to pull and he misses. That ball might have clipped his helmet I reckon
The concussion protocol underway but that was a slower short ball and wouldn't have ruffled him much.
Gerald Coetzee to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, short ball, Ayush Badoni pulls it down to deep mid for a single
Hardik Pandya to Ayush Badoni, THATS OUT!! Run Out!!

Hardik Pandya to Ayush Badoni, out Ayush Badoni Run Out!! 1 run completed. It seemed Kishan missed a chance here! That was short, wide, Ayush Badoni slapped the cut past point. The throw from the man at deep cover was a good one. Kishan collected it well as well but he missed whipping the bails off at the first instance. The dive from Badoni though was a clumsy one and his bat popped up as he dived. Though his bat went beyond the line but it was in the air. He didn't like the call and was shocked but the third umpire had a look and verified the fact that the bat was in the air despite the dive. Ayush Badoni run out (Naman Dhir/Ishan Kishan) 6(6) [4s-1]
Krunal Pandya, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Hardik Pandya to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, gets it down to long-on for a single
Hardik Pandya to Pooran, no run, slower delivery, angled across, Pooran looked to heave it away and misses. 11 needed off 9 balls

Hardik Pandya to Pooran, wide, very full, very wide, Pooran looks to chase that and misses. Has been wided. 10 needed now. MI decided to review it but the ball was outside the tramline and the call of wide remained
Ashton Turner IPL scores 0(1) 0(1) 0(1) 3*(7) 5(9)
Hardik Pandya to Pooran, 2 runs, very full, outside off, Pooran squeezed it fine and the man at deep point did well to dive and stop it to his right

Hardik Pandya to Pooran, FOUR, lucky! MI needed some slice of luck. But LSG seem to be having that. Was a fuller one, outside off, Pooran looked to slog it and got an inside edge. The ball went past the dive of the keeper to his right for a four. Only four needed
Hardik Pandya to Pooran, 1 run, fuller length delivery, outside off, Pooran drills it and the man at long-off does well to stop it. Only 3 needed off the final over
Mohammad Nabi [1.0-0-13-1] is back into the attack
Nabi to Pooran, 2 runs, scores are level! Looked to push at it and got an inside edge on to the on-side. They get a brace

Nabi to Pooran, 1 run, goes down on one knee, looked to power it and managed to get a top-edge on the shot. The ball went over the man at mid-off. They get a single as David failed to grab that. That is it. LSG win again at home. This is their sixth win of the season and they move to third on the table

23:24 Local Time, 17:54 GMT, 23:24 IST: MI fought till the end but have lost in the final over. The wicket wasn't the flattest for sure and that meant the bowlers did have a say, for a change that is. MI scored only 144 earlier and that I think was never enough despite this being a sluggish wicket. LSG were clever in the chase as well. They kept Bumrah at bay. Picked their bowlers and got those timely boundaries to stay ahead in the game. Rahul looked solid and Stoinis got a fifty. That covered most of the chase. They lost a few wickets towards the end. But Pooran held his nerves to finish it off in the final over. MI remain with three wins out of 10 games. Their chances of making it to the top four is very bleak now even if they win all their games. LSG though have strengthened their chances of making it to the top four.
Stat: First instance of chasing side winning in MI vs LSG contests across five matches.
Bumrah in MI defeats this season 3/14 vs GT 0/36 vs SRH 0/26 vs RR 0/27 vs CSK 0/37 vs RR 1/35 vs DC 0/17 vs LSG

Hardik Pandya: I think losing early wickets is tough to recover from and that's what we couldn't do it (recover) today. You still have to see the ball and hit. We just missed those balls and got out, that has been the kind of season we have had so far. I have always believed that you will be up and you'll be up, just that you got to give it your all. A lot of things to learn from this game. It has been fantastic. I think he (Wadhera) did last year as well, he couldn't get opportunities earlier (in the tournament) but he will play a lot of IPL and (represent) India eventually.

Justin Langer | LSG head coach: That's a smile, we were bitterly disappointed with our last game. So to be able to fightback against Mumbai Indians and get the points, that's certainly a smile. What I am learning in this competition is every game is hard and every game is vital. So to get the points, we are thrilled with that. (Bowling performance) It was outstanding, I thought we had all bases covered. You are always looking to take wickets in the powerplay. When you do that, you are always ahead of the game. It's the first time, besides Bangalore early in the tournament, we took those early wickets and that set us up nicely. (On Mayank Yadav) Looks like he's sore in the same spot, his rehab's been absolutely perfect, he bowled pain-free in the last few week or so, he's looked in great condition. We'll have a scan and we'll find out tomorrow. (On Marcus Stoinis) He's been a real match-winner. Took a good catch early as well. He's just showing us that presence at the top of the order which we probably demanded after the first 4 or 5 games. He's showing that real presence, he's playing well, he's being a match-winner. In T20 cricket, in IPL cricket, in big tournaments, match-winners are crucial if you are going to keep progressing. It's such a tight tournament, I have been blown away by how brilliant this IPL tournament is. It's a bit like a World Cup. There's no easy games, every point is crucial. We see how tight it is on the table. For us to take those points tonight, really valuable. Most importantly, after our disappointing last loss, I loved how we fought back and that's a sign of a really good team.

KL Rahul: We still had batters in the middle. An experienced batter in Pooran and KP is seasoned as well. Was a bit dry. 165-170 would have made it a competitive game. It takes time to adjust to this wicket. Our bowlers did well and put pressure on them. Always happy when you get those two points. We need to gain momentum in the back end of the tournament and the momentum helps. I haven't spoken to Mayank much. He had some pain in his sides. He said I0$. So, I asked him to go out. He is useful for us. We need to take care of him. He bowled wide yorkers and slower bumpers today which was good to see. We are giving him a free hand.

Marcus Stoinis: I have had the nickname (Hulk) longer compared to Tim David. Nice to bowl with the new ball. Nice role. I didn't expect to bowl three in the powerplay. Thought the wicket was okay. We could have pushed the envelope and scored faster. But it is a little tricky. It was a dragged down delivery which I got out to. It stuck a little. Was disappointing to get out. Look I have been here, this is my third year. I have built close bonds with the franchise here. Everything is good here.

The game was won by LSG in both the powerplays. They had MI reeling when they bowled and had a bargain of four wickets for 28 runs. When LSG batted, they raced to 52 for 1 while chasing a meagre 145. LSG closed the game during these two phases. Kishan and Wadhera recovered it a little for MI but they were clearly short by at least 25 on that deck. Credit to Stoinis for having cashed in on his good form. He got out for a duck in his last game but brushed it aside as an aberration tonight. Mayank's injury concerns would be the only thing that LSG would be worried about. They are gelling well. We gelled well and dished you every update of the game. But time for us to wrap it up. Our team of Abhinand Raghavendran, Nikhil Jadhav, Siva and Kumar Abhisekh Das bids you bye bye! Ciao!
